attributes.action: provide a statutory defence for crossing a red light, to allow emergency vehicles to pass.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There have been cases where a vehicle has crossed a red light, in order to clear the way for an emergency vehicle, only for the driver to be convicted of crossing the light.

There should be a statutory defence for a driver crossing a red light, in such circumstances, that he/she was  doing so to assist the emergency services.

If a prosecution is felt appropriate, it should be up to the prosecution to demonstrate that the driver's action, in crossing the red light, amounted to driving without due care and attention/dangerous driving etc., before he/she can be convicted.

Simply crossing a red light, in such circumstances, should not, of itself, be an offence.
